title: Error in assignment statements - explain error

content.description:
The following code segment contains an error.
 double pi = 3.14; // line 1
pi = 3.14159; // line 2
double other = null; // line 3
double example; // line 4
example = pi; // line 5
content.question: Which of the following best describes the error in this code segment?

choices.label: In line 2,  pi  is assigned a value after it was already assigned a value in line 1.
In line 3,  null  cannot be assigned to a non-reference type.
In line 4,  example  should be assigned a value.
In line 5, a variable cannot be assigned to another variable.

content.answer: In line 3,  null  cannot be assigned to a non-reference type.

skill.text: 3.D: Explain why a code segment will not compile or work as intended and modify the code to correct the error.
